name: Basic Integration Formulas
latex: \int x^n dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} + C, \quad \int e^x dx = e^x + C, \quad \int \frac{1}{x} dx = \ln|x| + C
explanation: Basic integration formulas are the reverse of derivative rules. The power rule for integrals adds 1 to the exponent and divides by the new exponent. The integral of e^x is e^x. The integral of 1/x is the natural logarithm. These fundamental integrals form the foundation for more complex integration techniques.

steps: Power rule: add 1 to exponent, divide by new exponent
The derivative of e^x is e^x,
so the integral is also e^x + C
